data.text:
The age old debate.

What Men think is pretty and what women find pretty or attractive can sometimes be a lot different or a lot alike.

I know Iâ€™ve had this conversation with a few friends of mine and we have decided that there are just some styles of clothing, hair or makeup that most men find unattractive and too far â€œout thereâ€ for them to even understand (Silly boys!).

I love â€œdifferentâ€ or weird things (probably because Iâ€™m little odd myself!) and I get to work in the beauty industry with all kinds of stylish people. We get to have fun and experiment with our clothes, makeup and hair! No boring cooperate suits for moi!! (not that there is anything wrong with that, just not for me ğŸ™‚ )

In the last few years from listening to guys I know and their unsolicited â€œopinionsâ€ , Iâ€™ve come to discover some things our male counterparts just donâ€™t like or as I like to put itâ€¦â€they just donâ€™t â€˜getâ€™ about fashionâ€â€¦ Most Men like pretty, simple looks. Whether thatâ€™s a basic tee and jeans or a plain figure flaunting dress. Which by no means I donâ€™t love too! but Iâ€™m just discussing the differences between what women and men can find attractive in women.

Above- faux leather crop top + slouchy printed pants = my father and bfâ€™s worst nightmare in an outfit, yet all the women at the party loved it. I looked so â€œhipâ€™ and â€œright out of new Yorkâ€ as one of my grand aunts statedâ€¦.funny because this did come from my New York trip! Bam! ğŸ˜‰ Sorry, not sorry!!!!!!!

1) Crop tops, floral headbands, huge statement jewelry, Rompers, Baggy pants, harem pants, bright patterned tights, high waisted anything(skirts,pants, etc.) . Do I love them all? Yes, Definitely! I live for rompers and anything stylish yet comfortable. But take these comments from the males in my life for instance when Iâ€™ve worn any of these items, i.e. from my father â€œoh, you already have your pjs onâ€ referring to my high waisted slouchy pants from last night or as Steve likes to fondly call my bright tights when I wear them â€œmy wrestling pantsâ€ or â€œmacho-man tightsâ€â€¦pfttt, but what do they know anyway!?!? ğŸ˜¦

2)Makeup- Now men â€œthinkâ€ (yes, I know, I had no idea that men had thoughts too) but they think like â€œnatural makeupâ€â€¦..or no makeup at all. And I doubt they know that the natural look takes like 25 different products to make you look like you arenâ€™t wearing any makeup!!!!!! wtf!? When reallyâ€¦â€¦

^^^^Pretty self explanatory.

Iâ€™m not saying some men donâ€™t like smokey eyes or crazy colored lipstick, but Iâ€™m going to go out on a limb here and say the majority are just confused when it comes to this stuff. They confuse easily, so if your man doesnâ€™t like these things, try and tone it down a little bit. Or if youâ€™re anything like me, wear it anyway!! LOL ğŸ˜‰

Oh! and donâ€™t forget those fake lashes and nailsâ€¦â€¦men love thoseâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦..

3) Hair- I know tons of ladies that cut their hair off right after their wedding and after the long process of growing it out to wear it in a updo for their big day. I also know tons of ladies that have beautiful faces that are just emphasized by shorter dos. However, men are hardwired to like long luscious locks. Something to do with finding an â€œidealâ€ mate and fertility or whatever. Its programmed into them since the stone age and probably will never change. But if you want to hack your hair off, which I have done numerous times throughout my life, Do it! Hair grows and you donâ€™t judge your men for his mismatched socks and scruff on his face, so he shouldnâ€™t say anything but â€œthat looks nice, dear!â€

Hair color is another touchy subject. Iâ€™d say the majority of men like â€œnaturalâ€ colored hair. No crazy purples, reds or blues. Personally, I love that stuff and if you can be confident and pull it off, thatâ€™s awesome!

Conclusion-

I think if a woman likes something and its not the norm, wear it anyway. Fashion and makeup are supposed to be fun and reflect everyoneâ€™s individual tastes. This also applies to men. If you look back at pictures of yourself and say â€œew, I hate what I woreâ€ or â€œwhat was I thinking with that hair cutâ€â€¦least you have something to laugh at when your 90. No bodies perfect.

-Nicole xo ğŸ™‚

P.s.

Now all this being said, In my case I may be biased because I live in a small town. With a community where anything â€œreally differentâ€ is judged. By men AND women alike. I know in bigger cities, itâ€™s no biggie to have crazy colored hair and to wear whatever the hell you want and walk down the street without awkward stares! I really wish CB would just catch up already!
